reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic experience at Sumatera Restaurant NYC! The food was incredibly authentic and flavorful, and the service was warm and attentive. A genuinely lovely atmosphere tops it off. Highly recommend!
Tempat makannya cukup ramai, rasanya medhok dan porsinya sangat cukup. Saya datang berdua dan dua menunya tidak ada yang gagal. Akan datang kembali.
Their Nasi Padang tastes so good!

Patagor was great. But rice cake noodle and nasi padang bungkus was surprisingly mid/subpar. Some components taste stale, and the beef rendang was eh. Maybe because we ate there late, at 8pm? The nasi padang bungkus elsewhere was better.

Entirely satisfying without compromise. Everything on the menu tastes great! This restaurant invested in design, but more importantly in good people. oh yes, the team members are notably personable. This place outperforms all others.
Pretty decent for the bakmie Ayam . Not recommend the pempek though
Makanya enak
They charge tip 25% and if we pay even with debit card, they charge for fee.
i love the indonesian cusine here! it felt like home
Tasty!
The food was amazing. The beef randang and curry noodles were especially good and flavorful. Can‚Äôt say enough good things about the service. Will be back.
Nasi padang!
I love the food here! I go here when I miss Indo food ü•∞
yummmyyyyy
Savory and light dishes here. And nice variety on the menu. I recommend the Mie Komplit. Also nice that it‚Äôs halal.
Lontong sayur and iga bakar‚Ä¶ Perfect combo that is very close to home. Balanced mix of spices and tenderness in the iga. Definitely worth the shot!
So glad I stopped by here, feels very authentic and a mix of so many different flavors. Definitely recommend this dish.

Went here yesterday, I got the Nasi Padang and it was really good. Makes me miss the ones I got back home in Bekasi. I wish I could pay Indonesian prices, though. Jokes aside, the food was spot on. Completely authentic. Though, I wish the variety of the Nasi Padang is expanded further with stuff like tunjang, kerupuk kulit, ayam pop, etc. Would definitely go back :)
Makan disini bareng temen, di service sangat Baik. Rendang ya juara!!!! Top notch.
Chicken satays are delicious, creamy. Ayam goreng sambal ijo is very yummy, the sauce is so good. Ayam bakar Padang is sweet and spicy, so flavorful and creamy üòã

The menu choices are consistently excellent! This cuisine brings authentic flavors forward. The place has a pleasant ambiance. Employees here handle special requests with gracious accommodation. My weekend visit here was excellent.

I ordered the Mie Goreng Seafood and Sumatera's Coffee today, but something strange really stood out to me. The guy (I believe he was the owner) asked me if I wanted the coffee "black, or with cream" and if I wanted it with "white sugar or palm sugar," and I simply just said, "Cold coffee with cream and white sugar" (very standard, right?). But once I got the check, I was charged $5 for "Sumatera's Palm Sugar Coffee" even though that's not what I had ordered. When I asked about it, he said the $3 item was for black coffee (without cream, no palm sugar) but I had specifically ordered it with regular sugar. For reference, the palm sugar coffee was $3.50 on the menu. So even if that was ordered, that means if you want cream in your coffee, it's an extra $1.50.. LOL! I've never seen anything ridiculously overcharged like that in my life! Further, none of these "additional charges" were stated on the menu. Maybe he thought I was a tourist, but I digress.

Not to mention, the coffee was nothing special -- mediocre at best -- and the portion of the food was very small for the price compared to other similar restaurants in the area. Needless to say, I will not be returning mainly because of how shady they are, and the portions you get for the food is just not worth it.
Very good Indonesian food. They all taste good!
Nasi padang udang sambal petai nya the bestttt! fresh petaiiii fresh prawn!! And spicyyyyy!! Ketopraknya juga kaya punya abang abang di jakartaü´∂üèªü´∂üèª cant wait to come back!
Food was amazing. I ordered Mie komplit, it‚Äôs  very well balanced and the broth was light and comforting
Nasi Goreng Komplit and the Pempek is very good. The topping for the nasi goreng is a lot. Will definitely return.
Makanannya enak, murah tidak terlalu mahal dan tempat nya juga luas nyaman aman serta bersih
If you are looking for authentic Indonesian restaurant, definetly this is the place to go!
Good food , good service
Nasi Padang is a stapple here! Love the Rendang

The food here is absolutely delicious and tastes so authentic! As an Indonesian, I feel right at home in this heavenly place. There‚Äôs a wide variety on the menu, and the prices are quite reasonable for the generous portions you get. Plus, the staff is super friendly and are more than happy to accommodate our dietary requests. It‚Äôs a lovely experience all around!

Have eaten at the restaurant for years, the food is fresh and made with so much love. Great music playing in the background, the staff is very attentive. Please come to this restaurant and try one of New York‚Äôs hidden gems!
Es teler enak dan segar banget, nasi ayam pecel enak banget

1,000/10!
We ordered Padang Set OMG so delicious! The taste also authentic! Nasi uduk smells so good. We also order batagor, yummy.
Really good. One of the few places that serve  authentic Indonesian food in NY
Authentic Indonesian food!! So yummy.

I was thoroughly impressed with everything! This restaurant offers good return on your money. Every dish demonstrates excellence. Staff members are kind and their food suggestions are always right. This spot is a standout and I can hardly wait to return!
Best Indonesian food in NYC!
Perfect food
Audrey is the goat

Delicious Indonesian food, and friendly staff.  The portion is good.  The chicken satay has a good amount of peanut sauce, and is tasty.  Soto betawi is also good, which has a thicker coconut soup compared to other places.  Try the mie komplit as well.
The food reminds me of home.
Very, nice
The food is very good here, really tasty and loved it also a very nice atmosphere

Came here for the first time and ordered the Thai iced tea and the Nasi Lemak Rendang. The tea was refreshing and sweet to my taste. It was my first time trying the entree dish and was great and perfectly balanced, between the savory rendang, acidity of the pickles and sweetness of fried anchovies. Great experience overall; must try if craving southeast Asian food in the neighborhood.

I came here for dinner and ordered the Mie Seafood soup noodle and Thai iced tea. The soup broth and noodles were very delicious. The Thai iced tea was perfect level of sweetness for my taste (not too sweet). The waitresses were very nice and attentive the whole time. I left feeling full and very satisfied.

I ate lunch for the first time today at Sumatera and this was my 2nd time trying Indonesian food. The place was small, but very cozy. The people were so friendly and answered any questions I had. The best part was the food, which was an explosion of flavors and textures! Thankfully, I live close by and I plan to be a regular customer. I can't wait to go back and try different dishes. Indonesian food isn't well known, but it's fast becoming one of my favorite cuisines!
The chicken is moist and flavorful! Marinated well. Goes perfectly with the sambal and nasi uduk.
Their service is immaculate with incredible food. They bring out the unique flavors of Indonesian culture, a pleasant and perfect amount of flavor on each dish.
The food was great and the service was speedy. The fried chicken, R1, was well cooked. The chicken was Crispy and juicy.
R18 and R1, satay chicken were also really good. I liked the sambal terasi. Think I prefer my sambal sweet. Hit the spot for south East Asian cravings!

I've been several times to this place at this point, and I can confidently say that this is a gem.

The space itself is small, and while it is nice inside, it can be cramped and loud.  What can be helped is helped, though -- service is nice and receptive to alterations, and the area is clean.

The food itself is really great.  The menu's big, but there's recommended menu items that are very good for those who don't know what to get.  It's also halal, which isn't a big deal for me, but is for any Muslims, obviously.

There's a surcharge on any credit card payments, but not on Zelle or Venmo, so use those when you go.

This place is consistently good, and I hope to come many times more!
Amazing food and atmosphere. I had food on Banana leaf platter (r18). Very friendly service and ambience. Peanut sauce on satay was next level!Highly recommend!

This restaurant offers authentic Indonesian cuisine that is halal, providing a delightful dining experience. The staff is friendly and attentive, enhancing the overall atmosphere. The portions are generous, and the prices are reasonable, making it a great value for money. A must-try dish is the satey ayem, which is served with an exceptional sauce that truly elevates the flavor.

Asli ini masakannya sih enak enak punya.
Bukan kaleng kaleng ini sih temen temen. Kalau kalian mau cobain makanan khas Indonesia di NYC, wajib cobain Sumatera Restaurant. Ada berbagai macam menu khas Indonesia.

rasa masakannya TOP SEKALI ENAK SEKALI
SEMOGA PANJANG UMUR DAN SUKSES SELALU BISNISNYA. SEMAKIN LUAS NANTI TEMPAT MAKANNYA. TUHAN MEMBERKATI.

We had the bunkgus bagus with fish, and had to try rendang and satay cuz that‚Äôs what we know about SEA food. Amazing execution, I especially love the kale with curry, and the spicy shrimp paste pack so much flavor. Waiting for my Chindol while I write this.

One of the best Indonesian restaurants I‚Äôve ever visited! We tried their Batagor, their crispy Kulit, their complete Mie Ayam, and their Nasi Goreng Kepiting. Everything was so good, well-seasoned, and balanced! The employees are also very welcoming and warm. If you‚Äôre around, give this place a visit!

I came here with my Indonesian friend to try some authentic Indonesian food, and everything was absolutely delicious. The chicken satay was packed with flavor, especially with the peanut sauce and cucumber. The nasi goreng and mie tek-tek were also incredibly tasty. This place truly made me fall in love with Indonesian food.

Back second time to try out more dishes! Kawtiew got wok qi, fried chicken very on point and uses small chicken, coconut chicken soup is not heavy at all, overall a solid meal and so glad this is in my neighborhood

I havent had Indonesian food in over a year. I immediately ordered Nasi Bungkus Padang and Tahu Gejrot. Oh, it‚Äôs so good! Made me miss my home country. I also ordered a bunch of take out for my husband and kids.

This Indonesian restaurant offers delicious, authentic dishes packed with rich flavors and spices. The service is warm and attentive, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. A great spot for anyone looking to explore traditional Indonesian cuisine.
Intimate and cozy space with a great Indonesian hospitality. The food is always good and consistent. Love it and will always return.

The food was so good it tasted amazingly delicious . Dessert were magnificent. We are happy that we get Very authentic halal indonesian food away from home. Definitely will recommend to fellow friends!
Delicious Indonesian food! As an Indonesian, I can testify that this place sells authentic food from various regions in Indonesia. Highly recommended!
1st time here and also 1st time trying Indonesian food.. I must say that it exceeds my expectation!! Love the food here!! You‚Äôve gotta try these 2 dishes!!! üòç‚ú®

Best Indonesian restaurant in New York! The kwetiaw just tastes like what I usually have in Indonesia, the Iga Bakar and Bebek are also delicious. Love it!

One more thing, their music taste is also lovely. Would visit again!

Finally tried Indonesian food here in NYC and it honestly helped soothe my craving and homesickness for Indo food. I had Nasi Goreng, Mie Tek Tek, and Nasi Padang Bungkus‚Ä¶ it tasted so comforting, reminded me of home. Sambalnya nendang banget! Will definitely come back!!üòãüòãüòãüòã

I love Indonesian food, and this was my first time trying it at this restaurant, and it did not disappoint. The food is outstanding. I believe there are differences in cooking styles depending on the region in Indonesia. I've mostly tried Javanese dishes, but this restaurant offers a different style of Indonesian cuisine that I had never experienced before. I'll definitely go back. Just keep in mind that parking can be a bit challenging if you drive there.

Cozy Indonesian restaurant with delicious food and reasonable prices. Very authentic tasting and the service was pleasant! Definitely recommend!! The chicken satay was delicious, that peanut sauce was out of this world!

The fried chicken was good so was the green chili sauce. But the portions were a total JOKE. It was one of the skinniest drumsticks I‚Äôve ever had and my friend‚Äôs beef dish came with like literally three small chunks of beef! Note that these are regular portion sizes since the restaurant doesn‚Äôt offer a lunch menu. Given the price point, would never return.

5 stars
I had an amazing experience at Sumatera in NYC! The atmosphere is warm and inviting with an authentic Indonesian charm. Every dish we tried was packed with rich flavors ‚Äî from the tender rendang to the perfectly spiced sambal dishes, everything was delicious and clearly made with care. It‚Äôs a gem of a spot that brings true Indonesian cuisine to the city ‚Äî can‚Äôt wait to come back!

Sangat mengobati kangen masakan indonesia saat NYC. Saya pesan nasi padang bungkus utk perjalanan kereta luar kota amtrak. Utk lidah indonesia sambalnya cukup sesuai (jgn bandingkan dgn harga di indonesia). Pemiliknya sepertinya cindo, saya lupa bertanya mengenai kehalalan ayam potong dan daging sapinya. Saya dtg saat 10 mnt sebelum buka tp diperbolehkan utk masuk. Thank u Ci.
Very authentic!!! We love it so much,specially nasi padang bungkus and nasi padang set is the best!
Yum yum! They have big tables down in the basement. Large parties with tv and speakers. Food is amazing! Tasty üòã
Gravy Egg Noodle is the best!! Got yummy Indonesian cuisine + cozy restaurant. Really recommend this!
One of the best Indonesian restaurant options in New York City. You can‚Äôt go wrong with their Nasi Padang!
‚ÄúI had a fantastic lunch. The food all good, the service was prompt, and the atmosphere nice. A price is standard , but worth it. Highly recommend!‚Äù

Very happy to have found this restaurant tucked in a busy area of Elmhurst. You will be greeted by friendly people and there are about 2-3 dining tables.
I ordered the nasi (rice) padang bungkus (wrapped) with ayam goreng (fried chicken), a dish unique to a city of an Indonesian province West Sumatra. The rice comes wrapped in a banana leaf and contains sambal (chili sauces), a tofu, a potato patty, sambal chips, jackfruit, egg, kale, and fried chicken. The sambal sauce/chips really add a kick of spicy, savory flavor that is quite unique to Indonesian cuisine. Places like this make me so glad to be in close proximity to the 5 boroughs and get an authentic taste of international foods. Yay!
There are fish and beef combos with this meal instead of the chicken as well. The beef comes in empal (fried) and rendang (dry curry)...hopefully will try that next time.
Makun yuk (Let's eat!)
Very intimate and cozy restaurant, ordered variety of food that arrived quickly and was delicious (beef tongue, green tea salad)
semua enak. all good. tempatnya dingin.. kita order avocado juices, nasi padang so good, soto mie juga enak bgt!! perfectooo

If you‚Äôre missing the flavors of home, this place is a must-visit Indonesian restaurant that truly captures the essence of authentic cuisine. The moment you walk in, you‚Äôre enveloped in a warm and inviting atmosphere that feels like a little slice of Indonesia.

I ordered the nasi bungkus, lontong cap gomeh and pempek palembang (fish cake with spicy sour sauce) and all dishes transported me straight back to my childhood. The nasi bungkus was beautifully wrapped and packed with fragrant rice, tender meat, and a variety of delicious sides. Each bite was a comforting reminder of home-cooked meals, with flavors that felt familiar and nostalgic.

The lontong cap gomeh was equally impressive. The rice cakes were perfectly steamed, served in a rich and flavorful broth filled with vegetables and protein. It was hearty and satisfying, evoking memories of family gatherings and festive celebrations.

The service was friendly and welcoming, making the experience even more enjoyable. If you‚Äôre craving authentic Indonesian flavors or simply want to reminisce about home, Sumatera resto is the place to be. It‚Äôs a true culinary haven that brings the heart of Indonesia right to your plate!

First time come here. Missing indonesian food so bad. I got nasi lemak with chicken and it was so delicious . My husband got chicken satay. ü§§ Their food filled me up with satisfaction. Feel like home. I even took away one of their menu. Tahu gejrot. üòÅ

I‚Äôve never had Indonesian food before and drove from NJ after a friend told me this place had authentic Indonesian food. She was not wrong. Everything she recommended I try was delicious and the atmosphere makes me feel as if I‚Äôm eating a meal at my parent‚Äôs house. If I lived in the area I would be stopping in for lunch. But, I will definitely come back here in the near future.
Wow the food here is great! First time coming but will definitely come back for more delicious Indonesian food
